Description: Bronze axe-head: it was once thickly corroded but has now been completely cleaned. The metal of the blade is bright yellow in parts. Both faces and the shorter of the two sides are severely pitted and one of the lugs is cracked. The undamaged longer side can be seen to have been finely bevelled. The cutting end was never fully worked to an edge and shows no signs of wear. A section of it has been corroded away on one face.
Curator's comments: Metallographic analysis has indicated that after casting the blade was worked and annealed and finished by grinding and that it was not used.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (159)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
